different HSE, 142 === you can define the HSE value in your toolchain compiler preprocessor. */ 143 144 /* ########################### System Configuration ######################### */ 148 #define /* UART register callback disabled */ 190 #define USE_HAL_USART_REGISTER_CALLBACKS 0U /* USART register callback disabled */ 191 #define USE_HAL_WWDG_REGISTER_CALLBACKS 0U /* WWDG register callback disabled */ 192 193 /* ########################## Assert Selection ############################## */ 198 /* #define USE_FULL_ASSERT 1U */ 199 200 /* ################## Ethernet peripheral configuration ##################### */ 201 202 /* Section 1 : Ethernet peripheral configuration */ 203 204 /* MAC ADDRESS: MAC_ADDR0:MAC_ADDR1:MAC_ADDR2:MAC_ADDR3:MAC_ADDR4:MAC_ADDR5 */ 205 #define MAC_ADDR0 2U 206 #define MAC_ADDR1 0U 207 #define MAC_ADDR2 0U 208 #define MAC_ADDR3 0U 209 #define MAC_ADDR4 0U 210 #define MAC_ADDR5 0U 211 212 /* Definition of the Ethernet driver buffers size and count */ 213 #define ETH_RX_BUF_SIZE ETH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE /* buffer size for receive */ 214 #define ETH_TX_BUF_SIZE ETH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE /* buffer size for transmit */ 215 #define ETH_RXBUFNB ((uint32_t)4U) /* 4 Rx buffers of size ETH_RX_BUF_SIZE */ 216 #define ETH_TXBUFNB ((uint32_t)4U) /* 4 Tx buffers of size ETH_TX_BUF_SIZE */ 217 218 /* Section 2: PHY configuration section */ 219 220 /* DP83848_PHY_ADDRESS Address*/ 221 #define DP83848_PHY_ADDRESS 0x01U 222 /* PHY Reset delay these values are based on a 1 ms Systick interrupt*/ 223 #define PHY_RESET_DELAY ((uint32_t)0x000000FFU) 224 /* PHY Configuration delay */ 225 #define PHY_CONFIG_DELAY ((uint32_t)0x00000FFFU) 226 227 #define PHY_READ_TO ((uint32_t)0x0000FFFFU) 228 #define PHY_WRITE_TO ((uint32_t)0x0000FFFFU) 229 230 /* Section 3: Common PHY Registers */ 231 232 #define PHY_BCR ((uint16_t)0x0000U) 233 #define PHY_BSR ((uint16_t)0x0001U) 235 #define PHY_RESET ((uint16_t)0x8000U) 236 #define PHY_LOOPBACK ((uint16_t)0x4000U) 237 #define PHY_FULLDUPLEX_100M ((uint16_t)0x2100U) 238 #define PHY_HALFDUPLEX_100M ((uint16_t)0x2000U) 239 #define PHY_FULLDUPLEX_10M ((uint16_t)0x0100U) 240 #define PHY_HALFDUPLEX_10M ((uint16_t)0x0000U) 241 #define PHY_AUTONEGOTIATION ((uint16_t)0x1000U) 242 #define PHY_RESTART_AUTONEGOTIATION ((uint16_t)0x0200U) 243 #define PHY_POWERDOWN ((uint16_t)0x0800U) 244 #define PHY_ISOLATE ((uint16_t)0x0400U) 246 #define PHY_AUTONEGO_COMPLETE ((uint16_t)0x0020U) 247 #define PHY_LINKED_STATUS ((uint16_t)0x0004U) 248 #define PHY_JABBER_DETECTION ((uint16_t)0x0002U) 250 /* Section 4: Extended PHY Registers */ 251 #define PHY_SR ((uint16_t)0x10U) 253 #define PHY_SPEED_STATUS ((uint16_t)0x0002U) 254 #define PHY_DUPLEX_STATUS ((uint16_t)0x0004U) 256 /* ################## SPI peripheral configuration ########################## */ 257 258 /* CRC FEATURE: Use to activate CRC feature inside HAL SPI Driver 259 * Activated: CRC code is present inside driver 260 * Deactivated: CRC code cleaned from driver 261 */ 262 263 #define USE_SPI_CRC 0U 264 265 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------*/ 270 #ifdef
